item.title: Blocked drainage, very smelly, very unhealthy with flies insects and extremely smelly posing hazard to local residence, 28th June
item.description:
The blockage has been on going for the last possible three months Water has accumulated with rubbish clay and anything else in the area. It has become a water resource for infectious flies mosquitoes and it smells extremely bad because the accumulated rubbish and other materials have mixed with the water posing sea threat to the local residence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Galleywall Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Victoria near Donaldson, 28th June
item.description:
Someone had left some kind of shower door that has broken and splintered into a million shards against our garden wall. It was a silver VW sharan with an 04 license plate. We think it was DC04UXM. A young man and an older man in the car.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Donaldson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Horrendous graffiti adjacent to my front door, 28th June
item.description:
Please could you remove this monstrosity as soon as possible, and most importantly can you prevent this to happen weekly? What’s your plan to fine people ruining my street? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kynaston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded road markings, 28th June
item.description:
Along Albion road the road markings have faded so cars have been parked in no parking zones obstructing access including to the Albion Surgery. Ambulance and medical vehicles have been blocked in or unable to access the surgery car park. Several obstructing cars have been reported but the drivers have moved them eventually without caution. However although it is obvious they are blocking access to a medical building the road markings do not make it clear enough. This needs to be rectified urgently. I note there are other reports on the same road concerning this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
